messages.content: What is ComfyUI-Crystools-save?

ComfyUI-Crystools-save is a quality of life extension for ComfyUI that allows users to save their workflows with a specific name and include additional metadata such as the author, description, and version.
Can others see the metadata information when a workflow is shared?
Yes, when a workflow is shared via png/json, others will be able to see the metadata information included by ComfyUI-Crystools-save.
What does the 'Use new save button?' setting do in ComfyUI-Crystools-save?

The 'Use new save button?' setting changes the default behavior of the 'save' button in ComfyUI. When turned on, it saves the workflow with the name of the project. If users don't want this, they can turn off this feature.
How can users view the metadata saved by ComfyUI-Crystools-save?
Users can view the metadata saved by ComfyUI-Crystools-save by using the 'Crystools' extension with a 'Show metadata' node. They need to ensure the 'workflow' option is selected.
What field in the metadata/json does ComfyUI-Crystools-save use to store the information?
ComfyUI-Crystools-save uses the 'workflow.extra' field in the metadata/json and creates an 'info' property to store the metadata information.
How can users install ComfyUI-Crystools-save from GitHub?
To install ComfyUI-Crystools-save from GitHub, users need to first install ComfyUI, then clone the ComfyUI-Crystools-save repo into the 'custom_modules' folder, and start up ComfyUI.
How can users install ComfyUI-Crystools-save from the manager?
To install ComfyUI-Crystools-save from the manager, users need to search for 'crystools' in the manager and install it.
What is the purpose of creating a bug report for ComfyUI-Crystools-save?
The purpose of creating a bug report is to help improve ComfyUI-Crystools-save by providing a clear and concise description of the bug.
What should be attached to make it easier for others to reproduce the error?
A workflow file should be attached to make it easier for others to reproduce the error.
What should be included in the 'Expected behavior' section of the bug report?
The 'Expected behavior' section should include a clear and concise description of what was expected to happen.
Are screenshots helpful in explaining the problem in the bug report?
Yes, if applicable, adding screenshots can help explain the problem in the bug report.
What should be included in the 'Error in console' section of the bug report?
If applicable, the error message from the console should be added in the 'Error in console' section of the bug report.
What information should be copied from the console output for the 'Versions' section?

The output of the console, including platform, Python version, total VRAM, total RAM, vram state, device information, and ComfyUI-Manager version and revision, should be copied for the 'Versions' section.
Is there a section for providing additional context about the problem in the bug report?
Yes, there is an 'Additional context' section where any other context about the problem can be added.
What should be included in the feature request description?
The feature request description should include a clear and concise description of what the problem is, such as 'I'm always frustrated when [...]'.
What should be described in the 'Describe the solution you'd like' section?
In the 'Describe the solution you'd like' section, you should provide a clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
What should be mentioned in the 'Describe alternatives you've considered' section?
In the 'Describe alternatives you've considered' section, you should give a clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
What can be added in the 'Additional context' section?
In the 'Additional context' section, you can add any other context or screenshots about the feature request.
What is the purpose of the 'about' field in the feature request template?
The 'about' field in the feature request template is used to provide a brief description or summary of the feature request.
What should be included in the 'title' field of the feature request template?
The 'title' field of the feature request template should contain a concise and descriptive title for the feature request.
What information can be provided in the 'labels' and 'assignees' fields of the feature request template?

The 'labels' field can be used to categorize or tag the feature request, while the 'assignees' field can be used to assign the feature request to specific individuals or teams responsible for addressing it.
